Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Private Litigation Case Title: Walsh v. Marsh & McLennan Companies, Inc. et al

Description: Marsh & McLennan Companies, Inc. agreed to pay $2.4 million in settlement of allegations it solicited secret payments from insurance companies in return for steering clients towards a particular company.
Insurance brokerage firm Marsh & McLennan agreed to pay $850 million to settle multistate allegations that it engaged in bid rigging, price fixing and the use of hidden incentive fees.

Marsh and McLennan agreed to pay $400 million to settle litigation brought by state pension funds in New Jersey and Ohio alleging that it made false and misleading statements related to contingent commissions from insurers.

Marsh and McLennan Companies, Inc. agreed to pay $7 million to settle multistate bid-rigging litigation alleging that Marsh engaged in anticompetitive conduct in the market for commercial liability insurance.
Info Source: Attorney General Martha Coakley Reaches Agreement with Insurance Brokerage Firm Marsh and McLennan, States News Service, January 5, 2009 (via Nexis).

Description: Mercer agreed to pay $500,000,000 to settle allegations of professional malpractice, breach of contract and unfair trade practices in advising the state on management of the Alaska Public Employees' Retirement System (PERS) and the State of Alaska Teachers' Retirement System (TRS).

Notes: Suspended portion of penalty reinstated in later Order
$34,378 civil penalty, and $5,000 reinstated penalty from Order D 06-04

Description: Marsh USA agreed to pay a $325,000 civil penalty in settlement of allegations it failed to pay surplus lines taxes in a timely fashion, failing to keep appropriate records, and failed to properly disclose the compensation it received, or provided clients with false or misleading information.

Agency: New Jersey Department of Banking & Insurance
New Jersey Department of Banking & Insurance
New York Department of Financial Services

Info Source: Texas' February Enforcements Bring Nearly $1M in Fines, Restitution, Insurance Journal, April 8, 2011 (via Nexis).
